subject: Re: [junit] Problem: testMethods executing out of order...
msgSnippet: Yes. You can t assume the order of tests, period. Your best bet is to use something like OrderedTestSuite (http://gsbase.sourceforge.net) to order the tests as
messageBody:
Yes. You can't assume the order of tests, period. Your best bet is to
use something like OrderedTestSuite (http://gsbase.sourceforge.net) to
order the tests as needed.

Also, a little suggestion. Change the setup() code to use this:

final Context context = new InitialContext();

It's generally a good practice to store objects in references to the
weakest useful type. It improves your code's resilience in the face of
change. (Sorry -- I couldn't resist.)

Good luck.

So said alleycoder <alison.craine@...> on 2003-01-30
--------------------

>I have been using JUnit with my EJB for awhile and it always ran the
>test methods in the order that they are in the code.. However, they
>just started to occationally run in a different order.. Which is
>causing problems.
>
>Has anyone come across this?
>

> }

> }

> }

>}

> 3) testRemoveOrg (which causes problems for the testUpdateOrg)
